content.thinking: The user wants me to add a contribution guide/link below the "Supported Provider" section in the README and commit it. Let me first read the README to understand the current structure.

1→# repiq 2→ 3→[![CI](https://github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/actions/workflows/ci.yml) 4→[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-blue.svg)](LICENSE) 5→[![Go](https://img.shields.io/github/go-mod/go-version/yutakobayashidev/repiq)](go.mod) 6→[![DeepWiki](https://img.shields.io/badge/DeepWiki-yutakobayashidev%2Frepiq-blue.svg?logo=data:image/png;base64,REDACTED)](https://deepwiki.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq) 7→ 8→AI agents pick libraries by guessing. repiq gives them real data instead. 9→ 10→``` 11→You: "Add an HTTP client library" 12→Agent: repiq npm:axios npm:ky npm:got → compares downloads, maintenance, dependencies → recommends with evidence 13→``` 14→ 15→repiq fetches stars, downloads, commit activity, and more from GitHub, npm, PyPI, crates.io, and Go Modules. It returns Markdown tables by default (or JSON with `--json`) -- no opinions, no scores. The agent reasons. You decide. 16→ 17→## Install 18→ 19→```bash 20→go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest 21→``` 22→ 23→Or with Nix: 24→ 25→```bash 26→nix run github:yutakobayashidev/repiq 27→``` 28→ 29→## Agent Skills 30→ 31→repiq is available as an [Agent Skill](https://agentskills.io/) for AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, etc.). 32→ 33→```bash 34→npx skills add github:yutakobayashidev/repiq 35→``` 36→ 37→With [agent-skills-nix](https://github.com/Kyure-A/agent-skills-nix): 38→ 39→```nix 40→sources.repiq = { 41→ github = { owner = "yutakobayashidev"; repo = "repiq"; }; 42→}; 43→skills.enable = [ "repiq" ]; 44→targets.claude.enable = true; 45→``` 46→ 47→## Quick Start 48→ 49→```bash 50→repiq github:facebook/react 51→``` 52→ 53→``` 54→## GitHub 55→ 56→| Target | Stars | Forks | Open Issues | Contributors | Releases | Last Commit (days) | Commits (30d) | Issues Closed (30d) | 57→|--------|-------|-------|-------------|--------------|----------|--------------------|---------------|---------------------| 58→| github:facebook/react | 234000 | 47000 | 1000 | 1700 | 220 | 0 | 80 | 150 | 59→``` 60→ 61→## Use Cases 62→ 63→- **Library comparison** -- compare downloads, maintenance activity, and dependency count across candidates in one command 64→- **Maintenance check** -- `last_commit_days`, `commits_30d`, and `issues_closed_30d` reveal whether a project is abandoned, stable, or actively developed 65→- **Download trends** -- `weekly_downloads` vs `monthly_downloads` (npm, PyPI): `weekly * 4 / monthly > 1` means accelerating adoption 66→- **License compliance** -- SPDX license identifiers from GitHub, npm, PyPI, crates.io, and Go for quick enterprise checks 67→- **Supply chain risk** -- `dependencies_count` shows how much a package pulls in; `reverse_dependencies` (crates.io) shows ecosystem penetration 68→- **Cross-ecosystem evaluation** -- compare equivalent packages across languages (e.g. zod vs pydantic vs serde) using GitHub as the common axis 69→ 70→### Examples 71→ 72→**Compare web frameworks** 73→ 74→```bash 75→repiq github:expressjs/express github:fastify/fastify github:honojs/hono npm:express npm:fastify npm:hono 76→``` 77→ 78→**Check if a repo is still maintained** 79→ 80→```bash 81→repiq github:some-org/some-lib 82→``` 83→ 84→**Evaluate ORM options** 85→ 86→```bash 87→repiq github:prisma/prisma github:drizzle-team/drizzle-orm github:typeorm/typeorm npm:prisma npm:drizzle-orm npm:typeorm 88→``` 89→ 90→**License check for enterprise adoption** 91→ 92→```bash 93→repiq github:facebook/react github:preactjs/preact github:sveltejs/svelte 94→``` 95→ 96→**Cross-ecosystem comparison** 97→ 98→```bash 99→repiq npm:zod pypi:pydantic crates:serde 100→``` 101→ 102→## Supported Providers 103→ 104→| Provider | Format | Example | 105→|----------|--------|---------| 106→| GitHub | `github:/` | `github:facebook/react` | 107→| npm | `npm:` | `npm:react`, `npm:@types/node` | 108→| PyPI | `pypi:` | `pypi:requests` | 109→| crates.io | `crates:` | `crates:serde` | 110→| Go Modules | `go:` | `go:golang.org/x/text` | 111→ 112→## Metrics 113→ 114→
115→GitHub (9 metrics) 116→ 117→| Metric | Description | 118→|--------|-------------| 119→| `stars` | Star count | 120→| `forks` | Fork count | 121→| `open_issues` | Open issue count (includes PRs) | 122→| `contributors` | Number of contributors | 123→| `release_count` | Total releases | 124→| `last_commit_days` | Days since last commit | 125→| `commits_30d` | Commits in the last 30 days | 126→| `issues_closed_30d` | Issues closed in the last 30 days | 127→| `license` | SPDX license identifier (e.g. MIT, Apache-2.0) | 128→ 129→
130→ 131→
132→npm (6 metrics) 133→ 134→| Metric | Description | 135→|--------|-------------| 136→| `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days | 137→| `monthly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 30 days | 138→| `latest_version` | Latest published version | 139→| `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | 140→| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies | 141→| `license` | License identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) | 142→ 143→
144→ 145→
146→PyPI (7 metrics) 147→ 148→| Metric | Description | 149→|--------|-------------| 150→| `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days | 151→| `monthly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 30 days | 152→| `latest_version` | Latest published version | 153→| `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | 154→| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies | 155→| `license` | License identifier | 156→| `requires_python` | Python version requirement (e.g. `>=3.9`) | 157→ 158→
159→ 160→
161→crates.io (7 metrics) 162→ 163→| Metric | Description | 164→|--------|-------------| 165→| `downloads` | Total all-time downloads | 166→| `recent_downloads` | Downloads in the last 90 days | 167→| `latest_version` | Latest stable version | 168→| `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | 169→| `dependencies_count` | Number of normal dependencies | 170→| `license` | SPDX license identifier | 171→| `reverse_dependencies` | Number of crates that depend on this one | 172→ 173→
174→ 175→
176→Go Modules (4 metrics) 177→ 178→| Metric | Description | 179→|--------|-------------| 180→| `latest_version` | Latest version tag | 181→| `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | 182→| `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies | 183→| `license` | License identifier (via deps.dev) | 184→ 185→> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals. 186→ 187→
188→ 189→## Output Formats 190→ 191→| Flag | Format | Description | 192→|------|--------|-------------| 193→| _(none)_ | Markdown | Tables grouped by provider (default) | 194→| `--json` | JSON | Single JSON array | 195→| `--ndjson` | NDJSON | One JSON object per line | 196→ 197→## Authentication 198→ 199→GitHub provider only. Token is resolved automatically: 200→ 201→1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI) 202→2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable 203→3. Unauthenticated (60 req/hour) 204→ 205→Other providers require no authentication. 206→ 207→## Development 208→ 209→```bash 210→# Enter dev environment (requires Nix) 211→nix develop 212→ 213→# Run tests 214→go test ./... 215→ 216→# Lint 217→golangci-lint run ./... 218→``` 219→ 220→## License 221→ 222→[MIT](LICENSE) 223→

file.content:
# repiq [![CI](https://github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/actions/workflows/ci.yml) [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-blue.svg)](LICENSE) [![Go](https://img.shields.io/github/go-mod/go-version/yutakobayashidev/repiq)](go.mod) [![DeepWiki](https://img.shields.io/badge/DeepWiki-yutakobayashidev%2Frepiq-blue.svg?logo=data:image/png;base64,REDACTED)](https://deepwiki.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq) AI agents pick libraries by guessing. repiq gives them real data instead. ``` You: "Add an HTTP client library" Agent: repiq npm:axios npm:ky npm:got → compares downloads, maintenance, dependencies → recommends with evidence ``` repiq fetches stars, downloads, commit activity, and more from GitHub, npm, PyPI, crates.io, and Go Modules. It returns Markdown tables by default (or JSON with `--json`) -- no opinions, no scores. The agent reasons. You decide. ## Install ```bash go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest ``` Or with Nix: ```bash nix run github:yutakobayashidev/repiq ``` ## Agent Skills repiq is available as an [Agent Skill](https://agentskills.io/) for AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, etc.). ```bash npx skills add github:yutakobayashidev/repiq ``` With [agent-skills-nix](https://github.com/Kyure-A/agent-skills-nix): ```nix sources.repiq = { github = { owner = "yutakobayashidev"; repo = "repiq"; }; }; skills.enable = [ "repiq" ]; targets.claude.enable = true; ``` ## Quick Start ```bash repiq github:facebook/react ``` ``` ## GitHub | Target | Stars | Forks | Open Issues | Contributors | Releases | Last Commit (days) | Commits (30d) | Issues Closed (30d) | |--------|-------|-------|-------------|--------------|----------|--------------------|---------------|---------------------| | github:facebook/react | 234000 | 47000 | 1000 | 1700 | 220 | 0 | 80 | 150 | ``` ## Use Cases - **Library comparison** -- compare downloads, maintenance activity, and dependency count across candidates in one command - **Maintenance check** -- `last_commit_days`, `commits_30d`, and `issues_closed_30d` reveal whether a project is abandoned, stable, or actively developed - **Download trends** -- `weekly_downloads` vs `monthly_downloads` (npm, PyPI): `weekly * 4 / monthly > 1` means accelerating adoption - **License compliance** -- SPDX license identifiers from GitHub, npm, PyPI, crates.io, and Go for quick enterprise checks - **Supply chain risk** -- `dependencies_count` shows how much a package pulls in; `reverse_dependencies` (crates.io) shows ecosystem penetration - **Cross-ecosystem evaluation** -- compare equivalent packages across languages (e.g. zod vs pydantic vs serde) using GitHub as the common axis ### Examples **Compare web frameworks** ```bash repiq github:expressjs/express github:fastify/fastify github:honojs/hono npm:express npm:fastify npm:hono ``` **Check if a repo is still maintained** ```bash repiq github:some-org/some-lib ``` **Evaluate ORM options** ```bash repiq github:prisma/prisma github:drizzle-team/drizzle-orm github:typeorm/typeorm npm:prisma npm:drizzle-orm npm:typeorm ``` **License check for enterprise adoption** ```bash repiq github:facebook/react github:preactjs/preact github:sveltejs/svelte ``` **Cross-ecosystem comparison** ```bash repiq npm:zod pypi:pydantic crates:serde ``` ## Supported Providers | Provider | Format | Example | |----------|--------|---------| | GitHub | `github:/` | `github:facebook/react` | | npm | `npm:` | `npm:react`, `npm:@types/node` | | PyPI | `pypi:` | `pypi:requests` | | crates.io | `crates:` | `crates:serde` | | Go Modules | `go:` | `go:golang.org/x/text` | ## Metrics
GitHub (9 metrics) | Metric | Description | |--------|-------------| | `stars` | Star count | | `forks` | Fork count | | `open_issues` | Open issue count (includes PRs) | | `contributors` | Number of contributors | | `release_count` | Total releases | | `last_commit_days` | Days since last commit | | `commits_30d` | Commits in the last 30 days | | `issues_closed_30d` | Issues closed in the last 30 days | | `license` | SPDX license identifier (e.g. MIT, Apache-2.0) |
npm (6 metrics) | Metric | Description | |--------|-------------| | `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days | | `monthly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 30 days | | `latest_version` | Latest published version | | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | | `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies | | `license` | License identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |
PyPI (7 metrics) | Metric | Description | |--------|-------------| | `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days | | `monthly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 30 days | | `latest_version` | Latest published version | | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | | `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies | | `license` | License identifier | | `requires_python` | Python version requirement (e.g. `>=3.9`) |
crates.io (7 metrics) | Metric | Description | |--------|-------------| | `downloads` | Total all-time downloads | | `recent_downloads` | Downloads in the last 90 days | | `latest_version` | Latest stable version | | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | | `dependencies_count` | Number of normal dependencies | | `license` | SPDX license identifier | | `reverse_dependencies` | Number of crates that depend on this one |
Go Modules (4 metrics) | Metric | Description | |--------|-------------| | `latest_version` | Latest version tag | | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish | | `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies | | `license` | License identifier (via deps.dev) | > Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.
## Output Formats | Flag | Format | Description | |------|--------|-------------| | _(none)_ | Markdown | Tables grouped by provider (default) | | `--json` | JSON | Single JSON array | | `--ndjson` | NDJSON | One JSON object per line | ## Authentication GitHub provider only. Token is resolved automatically: 1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI) 2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable 3. Unauthenticated (60 req/hour) Other providers require no authentication. ## Development ```bash # Enter dev environment (requires Nix) nix develop # Run tests go test ./... # Lint golangci-lint run ./... ``` ## License [MIT](LICENSE)

    38→feat(cli): add --csv output format
    39→fix(github): handle rate limit errors gracefully
    40→test(npm): add test for scoped package parsing

    48→

    53→- Use `httptest` for API mocking in tests
    54→- Validate identifiers to prevent SSRF/injection
    55→- Errors go in `Result.Error`, not Go error returns (partial failure support)
    56→- Always verify external API endpoints with `curl` before writing code against them

    61→
    62→- Scheme name
    63→- Successful fetch
    64→- Not found (404)
    65→- Empty/invalid identifier
    66→- Partial failure (some APIs fail, others succeed)
    67→
    68→```bash
    69→# Run all tests
    70→go test ./...
    71→
    72→# Run with verbose output
    73→go test ./... -v
    74→
    75→# Run a specific package
    76→go test ./internal/provider/github/...
    77→```
    78→
    79→## Reporting Issues
    80→
    81→- Use [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/issues)
    82→- Include the command you ran and the output
    83→- Include `repiq --version` output

file.content:
# Contributing to repiq

## Development Setup

```bash
# Requires Nix
nix develop

# Or with Go 1.24+
go test ./...
golangci-lint run ./...
```

## Making Changes

1. Fork the repository
2. Create a branch from `main`
3. Make your changes
4. Run tests and lint: `go test ./... && golangci-lint run ./...`
5. Commit following the [commit convention](#commit-messages)
6. Open a Pull Request

## Commit Messages

Follow [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/) with **required scope**.

```
<type>(<scope>): <description>
```

**Types:** `feat`, `fix`, `docs`, `build`, `chore`, `ci`, `refactor`, `test`, `perf`, `style`, `revert`

**Scopes:** `cli`, `provider`, `github`, `npm`, `pypi`, `crates`, `go`, `nix`, `deps`

Examples:

```
feat(cli): add --csv output format
fix(github): handle rate limit errors gracefully
test(npm): add test for scoped package parsing
```

PR titles must follow the same convention (squash merges use the PR title).

## Adding a New Provider

See [docs/adding-a-provider.md](docs/adding-a-provider.md) for a step-by-step guide with code examples and a checklist.

## Code Guidelines

- No external dependencies unless strictly necessary (only `google/go-github` currently)
- All providers must implement the `Provider` interface
- Use `httptest` for API mocking in tests
- Validate identifiers to prevent SSRF/injection
- Errors go in `Result.Error`, not Go error returns (partial failure support)
- Always verify external API endpoints with `curl` before writing code against them

## Tests

Every provider must have tests for:

- Scheme name
- Successful fetch
- Not found (404)
- Empty/invalid identifier
- Partial failure (some APIs fail, others succeed)

```bash
# Run all tests
go test ./...

# Run with verbose output
go test ./... -v

# Run a specific package
go test ./internal/provider/github/...
```

## Reporting Issues

- Use [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/issues)
- Include the command you ran and the output
- Include `repiq --version` output

content.text: CONTRIBUTING.mdが既にあるので、Supported Providersセクションの直後にコントリビューションへの導線を追加します。

## Metrics
